paragraph.heading: 2Compiling

list.item: Choose Open Project from the File menu.
Navigate to <Eiffel_ENViSioN!_installation_path>\compiler\examples\(.net version)\wel\step5\ and select tutorial_step5.eifp
Clicking open loads the selected project
Select Use existing Ace (control file) and click OK
Choose the directory where the project will be compiled, by default the same directory containing the Ace file.

paragraph.heading: 2Running
paragraph.paragraph: After launching the sample, you will see a ../../../reference/windows/wel_frame_window_chart.xmlWEL_FRAME_WINDOW displayed. By holding down the left mouse button, and moving the mouse (Within the client area of the window), you will be able to draw on the client are of the window. If you press the right mouse button, a ../../../reference/windows/wel_modal_dialog_chart.xmlWEL_MODAL_DIALOG will pop up which allows you to enter the thickness of the line that is drawn.
paragraph.heading: 2Under the Hood
paragraph.paragraph:
This system builds on tutorial
/libraries/wel/samples/tutorial/step4/index.xml step 4 by adding a ../../../reference/windows/wel_modal_dialog_chart.xmlWEL_MODAL_DIALOG. The class LINE_THICKNESS_DIALOG inherits ../../../reference/windows/wel_modal_dialog_chart.xmlWEL_MODAL_DIALOG and uses a WEL_SINGLE_LINE_EDIT to input the desired line width. This sample contains the following classes:
TUTORIAL_STEP5
MAIN_WINDOW
LINE_THICKNESS_DIALOG
APPLICATION_IDS
